data.question: What is the main goal of tuning pore size in square-lattice coordination networks?
data.answer: The main goal is for size-selective sieving of CO2.

data.question: What enables ultra-high selectivity for CO2 over N2 and CH4 in the material discussed?
data.answer: Tuning of pore-size in a coordination network enables ultra-high selectivity for CO2 over N2 and CH4.

data.question: Is Qc-5-Cu-sql-b stable to moisture?
What is the kinetic diameter of CO2 as mentioned in the text?
How does Qc-5-Cu-sql-b compare to Qc-5-Cu-sql-a in terms of CO2 adsorption at 293 K and 1 atm?
data.answer: Qc-5-Cu-sql-b adsorbs moderate quantities of CO2 at 293 K and 1 atm, but little CH4 or N2 under the same conditions, suggesting a sieving effect.

data.question: Does the performance of Qc-5-Cu-sql-b in CO2 adsorption get affected by humidity?
What is the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for Qc-5-Cu-sql-b?
Can Qc-5-Cu-sql-b revert back to Qc-5-Cu-sql-a after desolvation?
What phenomenon is exploited to control pore size in the material discussed?
data.answer: Supramolecular isomerism is exploited to control pore size.

data.question: What are the CO2/N2 (SCN) and CO2/CH4 (SCM) selectivities for Qc-5-Cu-sql-b?
Is the phenomenon of supramolecular isomerism previously exploited for controlling pore size?
What is the pore size of Qc-5-Cu-sql-b?
Does Qc-5-Cu-sql-b exhibit a higher CO2 uptake than Qc-5-Cu-dia at 293 K and 1 bar?
What is the effect of water vapor on the performance of Qc-5-Cu-sql-b?
data.answer: The performance of Qc-5-Cu-sql-b is largely unaffected by the presence of water vapor.

data.question: What is the CO2/H2O selectivity (SCW) for Qc-5-Cu-sql-b?
Is the carbon capture capacity of Qc-5-Cu-sql-b dependent on the gas mixture composition?
What future work is mentioned for Qc-5-Cu-sql-b?
data.answer: Future work will focus on creating membranes from Qc-5-Cu-sql-b.
